column4: Sorry if I'm repeating my question too much, but does anybody have a way to make sysfsutils start at boot? It's for my trackpoint configuration, and I really don't want to type sudo /etc/init.d/sysfsutils start in terminal every time I start Ubuntu.
you can use a small bash script and tell the sessions manager to run it at boot
you might wanna make the file your executing executable by your user rather than just root aswell
